descr.p: The ctypes unit contains the definitions of commonly found C types. It can be used when interfaces to C libraries need to be defined. The types here are correct on all platforms, 32 or 64 bit.
The main advantage of using this file is to make sure that all C header import units use the same definitions for basic C types.
The h2pas program can include the ctypes unit automatically in the units it generates. The -C command-line switch can be used for this.

element.name: cchar
element.short: C character type (No signedness specification, 8 bit integer)

element.name: cschar
element.short: C signed character type (8 bit signed integer)

element.name: cuchar
element.short: C unsigned character type (8 bit unsigned integer).

element.name: clong
element.short: long integer (32/64 bit, depending on CPU register size)

element.name: cslong
element.short: Signed long integer (32/64 bit, depending on CPU register size)

element.name: culong
element.short: Unsigned long integer (32/64 bit, depending on CPU register size)

element.name: clongdouble
element.short: Long precision floating point type (extended/double, depending on CPU)

element.name: operator :=(clongdouble): double
element.short: Override assignment operator for clongdouble type.

element.name: operator :=(double): clongdouble
element.short: Override assignment operator for clongdouble type.

element.name: csize_t
element.short: Generic type to contain a size of all kinds of structures

element.name: operator :=(clongdouble): double
element.short: Implement assignment of a clongdouble to a double type.
element.descr: This operator allows to assign a clongdouble to a Double type.

element.name: operator :=(double): clongdouble
element.short: Implement assignment of a double to a clongdouble type.
element.descr: This operator allows to assign a double to a clongdouble type.

element.name: operator +(Double, clongdouble): Double
element.short: Implement addition of clongdouble and double.
element.descr: This operator allows to add double and clongdouble typed values. The result is a double typed value.

element.name: operator +(clongdouble, Double): Double
element.descr: This operator allows to add clongdouble and double typed values. The result is a double typed value.

element.name: operator -(Double, clongdouble): Double
element.short: Implement subtraction of clongdouble and double.
element.descr: This operator allows to subtract a clongdouble typed value from a double typed value. The result is a double typed value.

element.name: operator -(clongdouble, Double): Double
element.short: Implement subtraction of double and clongdouble.
element.descr: This operator allows to subtract a double typed value from a clongdouble typed value. The result is a double typed value.

element.name: operator *(Double, clongdouble): Double
element.short: Implement multiplication of double and clongdouble.
element.descr: This operator allows to multiply a clongdouble typed value with a double typed value. The result is a double typed value.

element.name: operator *(clongdouble, Double): Double
element.short: Implement multiplication of clongdouble and double.
element.descr: This operator allows to multiply a double typed value with a clongdouble typed value. the result is a double typed value.

element.name: operator /(Double, clongdouble): Double
element.short: Implement division of clongdouble and double.
element.descr: This operator allows to divide a double typed value by a clongdouble typed value. the result is a double typed value.

element.name: operator /(clongdouble, Double): Double
element.short: Implement division of double and clongdouble.
element.descr: This operator allows to divide a clongdouble typed value by a double typed value. the result is a double typed value.

element.name: operator =(Double, clongdouble): Boolean
element.short: Implement equality of double and clongdouble.
element.descr: This operator compares the values of a clongdouble typed value and a double typed value, and returns True if the values are equal (only double precision is used).

element.name: operator =(clongdouble, Double): Boolean
element.short: Implement equality of clongdouble and double.
element.descr: This operator compares the values of a double typed value and a clongdouble typed value, and returns True if the values are equal (only double precision is used).

element.name: operator <(Double, clongdouble): Boolean
element.short: Implement less than comparison between clongdouble and double.
element.descr: This operator compares the values of a double typed value and a clongdouble typed value, and returns True if the double value is less than the clongdouble value.

element.name: operator <(clongdouble, Double): Boolean
element.short: Implement less than comparison between double and clongdouble.
element.descr: This operator compares the values of a clongdouble typed value and a double typed value, and returns True if the clongdouble value is less than the double value.

element.name: operator >(Double, clongdouble): Boolean
element.short: Implement greater than comparison between clongdouble and double.
element.descr: This operator compares the values of a double typed value and a clongdouble typed value, and returns True if the double value is greater than the clongdouble value.

element.name: operator >(clongdouble, Double): Boolean
element.short: Implement greater than comparison between double and clongdouble.
element.descr: This operator compares the values of a clongdouble typed value and a double typed value, and returns True if the clongdouble value is greater than the double value.

element.name: operator >=(Double, clongdouble): Boolean
element.short: Implement greater than or equal comparison between clongdouble and double.
element.descr: This operator compares the values of a double typed value and a clongdouble typed value, and returns True if the double value is greater than or equal to the clongdouble value.

element.name: operator >=(clongdouble, Double): Boolean
element.short: Implement greater than or equal comparison between double and clongdouble.
element.descr: This operator compares the values of a clongdouble typed value and a double typed value, and returns True if the clongdouble value is greater than or equal to the double value.

element.name: operator <=(Double, clongdouble): Boolean
element.short: Implement less than or equal comparison between clongdouble and double.
element.descr: This operator compares the values of a double typed value and a clongdouble typed value, and returns True if the double value is less than or equal to the clongdouble value.

element.name: operator <=(clongdouble, Double): Boolean
element.short: Implement greater than or equal comparison between double and clongdouble.
element.descr: This operator compares the values of a clongdouble typed value and a double typed value, and returns True if the clongdouble value is less than or equal to the double value.
